current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Federal Power Act to clarify the authority of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission
			 to prescribe just, reasonable, and not unduly discriminatory or
			 preferential terms, conditions, and compensation applicable to wholesale
			 demand response resource participation in organized wholesale energy,
			 capacity, and ancillary service markets.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 206(a) of the Federal Power Act

header.#text: Treatment of wholesale demand response resources

text.#text: by designating the first through third sentences as paragraphs (1) through (3), respectively; and
by adding at the end the following:

term.#tail:
means a reduction in the consumption of electric energy by customers from their expected
			 consumption in response to an increase in the price of electric energy or
			 to incentive payments designed to induce lower consumption of electric
			 energy.
means a resource capable of providing demand response.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may prescribe just, reasonable, and not unduly discriminatory or preferential terms,
			 conditions, and compensation applicable to wholesale demand response
			 resource participation in organized wholesale energy, capacity, and
			 ancillary service markets.

header.#text: Treatment of wholesale demand response resources

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S2947 IS: To amend the Federal Power Act to clarify the authority of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to prescribe just, reasonable, and not unduly discriminatory or preferential terms, conditions, and compensation applicable to wholesale demand response resource participation in organized wholesale energy, capacity, and ancillary service markets.
